fr.xephi.authme.datasource

Interface DataSource

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Reloadable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSqlDataSource, CacheDataSource, MySQL, PostgreSqlDataSource, SQLite

    public interface DataSource
extends Reloadable
    Interface for manipulating PlayerAuth objects from a data source.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods

    • Method Detail

      • isCached

        default boolean isCached()
        Return whether the data source is cached and needs to send plugin messaging updates.
        Returns:
        true if the data source is cached.

      • isAuthAvailable

        boolean isAuthAvailable(String user)
        Return whether there is a record for the given username.
        Parameters:
        user - The username to look up
        Returns:
        True if there is a record, false otherwise

      • getPassword

        HashedPassword getPassword(String user)
        Return the hashed password of the player.
        Parameters:
        user - The user whose password should be retrieve
        Returns:
        The password hash of the player

      • getAuth

        PlayerAuth getAuth(String user)
        Retrieve the entire PlayerAuth object associated with the username.
        Parameters:
        user - The user to retrieve
        Returns:
        The PlayerAuth object for the given username

      • saveAuth

        boolean saveAuth(PlayerAuth auth)
        Save a new PlayerAuth object.
        Parameters:
        auth - The new PlayerAuth to persist
        Returns:
        True upon success, false upon failure

      • updateSession

        boolean updateSession(PlayerAuth auth)
        Update the session of a record (IP, last login, real name).
        Parameters:
        auth - The PlayerAuth object to update in the database
        Returns:
        True upon success, false upon failure

      • updatePassword

        boolean updatePassword(PlayerAuth auth)
        Update the password of the given PlayerAuth object.
        Parameters:
        auth - The PlayerAuth whose password should be updated
        Returns:
        True upon success, false upon failure

        boolean updatePassword(String user,
                       HashedPassword password)
        Update the password of the given player.
        Parameters:
        user - The user whose password should be updated
        password - The new password
        Returns:
        True upon success, false upon failure

      • getRecordsToPurge

        Set<String> getRecordsToPurge(long until)
        Get all records in the database whose last login was before the given time.
        Parameters:
        until - The minimum last login
        Returns:
        The account names selected to purge

      • isLogged

        Query the datasource whether the player is logged in or not.
        Parameters:
        user - The name of the player to verify
        Returns:
        True if logged in, false otherwise

      • setLogged

        void setUnlogged(String user)
        Set a player as unlogged (not logged in).
        Parameters:
        user - The name of the player to change

      • hasSession

        boolean hasSession(String user)
        Query the datasource whether the player has an active session or not. Warning: this value won't expire, you have also to check the user's last login timestamp.
        Parameters:
        user - The name of the player to verify
        Returns:
        True if the user has a valid session, false otherwise

      • grantSession

        void grantSession(String user)
        Mark the user's hasSession value to true.
        Parameters:
        user - The name of the player to change

      • revokeSession

        void revokeSession(String user)
        Mark the user's hasSession value to false.
        Parameters:
        user - The name of the player to change

      • purgeLogged

        void purgeLogged()
        Set all players who are marked as logged in as NOT logged in.
